title: I really like reading gay fanfiction, but I am a girl, is that weird? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, I would say that makes you a very stereotypical slash/yaoi fan. The overwhelming majority of writers and consumers of slash fic are female, and the demographic tends to skew young, so if you’re 21 or younger that’s even more in keeping with it. I don’t know any straight males who admit to enjoying slash/yaoi and not many gay ones, either. (In fact, one admittedly-very-opinionated gay acquaintance actively hates most of it because it rarely to never is written by anyone who actually IS gay and/or male and in his opinion almost never includes believable sex.) Personally, not my kink. (Okay, two guys AND A GIRL isn’t so bad, but I can’t think of many fandoms where that’s popular.) Give me m/f dom/sub or dubcon any day if I want to go looking for smutfic.

No, not at all. What you read doesn’t necessarily reflect how you think. Personally, I like all kinds of romantic fiction (hetero, gay, lesbian, and bisexual), but that’s me. Possibly, you’re a bit uncomfortable around women in what could be construed as romantic or semi-romantic settings because of lesbian or bi feelings under the surface. Then again, it may be something else entirely. As some of the answers indicate, you may like gay fanfiction simply because it’s guys and you’re a girl. You don’t really say whether you’re straight, lesbian, or bi.
